Authors: Kurniawan Y., Luhukay D., Simarmata Z.S., Aditya S., Manurung V.F.
Title: Analysis usage of social media Facebook as a learning media on senior high school (Case study)
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Simarmata, Z.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aditya, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Manurung, V.F., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: E-Learning is a distance learning method that used internet technology. With e-learning, learners can study anytime and anywhere. In this study, the authors want to investigate whether the use of social media Facebook as a tool of learning with e-learning method has or has no effect on the learning interest of senior high school students. Ninth grade student of XYZ school in Jakarta has been selected as the sample in this study. The Facebook group under the name Forum Diskusi Matematika XI (9th Math Discussion Forum) was created and carried out on the research for 40 days. After 40 days, the authors provide questionnaires and collect the opinions of students related to learning with Facebook e-learning that has been going on. From the data obtained and analyzed, it can be concluded that the use of Facebook as a tool of learning affect the interest of students of XYZ senior high school. © IAEME Publication
Author Keywords: E-learning; E-learning method; Facebook; Group; Questionnaires
